The Ultimate Sales Machine by Chet Holmes



Chap 1: Time Management Secrets of Billionaires

  1. touch it once
  2. make lists (of 6 tasks to accomplish)
  3. plan how much time you will allocate to each task
  4. plan the day
  5. prioritize (focus on difficult projects first)
  6. ask yourself, "will it hurt me to throw this away?"

Chap 2: Instituting Higher Standards and Regular Training

Continuing education is a must. You should always be learning new things, or doing old things faster.

Chap 3: Executing Effective Meetings

Workshop ideas. Get feedback from your team members. Ensure everybody says something. These are ways to create, test and validate your ideas.

One person on your team is getting their work done twice as fast as everybody else. They need to be sharing their techniques.

Chap 4: Becoming a Brilliant Strategist

It's rare to be a strategist and a tactician

3% buying now
6-7% open to it
30% not thinking about it
30% don't think they're interested
30% know they are not interested

to reach the bottom 90% you need to use education-based marketing -- if you pitch to just sell, the bottom 90% will ignore you

Education based marketing allows you to talk to cold prospects in a natural way. Education based marketing builds credibility. Education based marketing adds value before you ask for anything in return.

Chap 5: Hiring Superstars

Top producers have a personality that has confidence and persistence.

For example, during an interview, challenge the interviewee right away. See if they will defend themselves. See if they will fight back for what they believe in. That's confidence.

When you're applying for a job, you want to be able to say: I will work be as persistent toward prospects as I am for getting this job.

Chap 6: The High Art of Getting the Best Buyers

Create a list of your "Dream 100" buyers. Then just focus relentlessly on your dream list. Even if you nab only a few, you'll be in good shape.

Chap 7: The Seven Musts of Marketing

  1. Advertise
  2. Direct Mail
  3. Corporate Literature: brochures and promotional pieces
  4. Public relations
  5. Personal contact: salespeople and customer service
  6. Market Education: trade shows, speaking engagements, and educated-based marketing
  7. Internet: Web sites, email efforts, and affiliate marketing

Chap 8: The Eyes Have It

Rules of Effective Presenting:

  1. KISS - Keep It Simple, Stupid
  2. Keep it Fast Paced
  3. use "wow" facts and statistics
  4. build in opportunities for stories
  5. your presentation should be curiosity driven
  6. Think of each headline as valuable real estate
  7. Be Confident but not obnoxious
  8. Focus on them, not you

8 Common Mistakes

  1. Thanking prospects for their time or apologizing for taking it
  2. presenting with your hands in your pockets
  3. presenting from a sitting position
  4. Being led around by your nose (letting the prospect lead the conversation)
  5. letting the materials upstage you or guide you
  6. keeping it totally serious
  7. Failing to practice the presentation each and every time before you give it
  8. Having no idea what comes next in the presentation

Chap 9: The Nitty-Gritty of Getting the Best Buyers

  1. Choose your Dream 100.
  2. Choose the gift (send them a fun, small, memorable gift)
  3. Choose your Dream 100 letters.
  4. Create your Dream 100 Calendar (market to your dream 100 at least once/month)
    • cards, letters, novelties, newsletters, promos, surveys, articles and press releases
  5. Conduct Dream 100 follow-up phone calls
  6. Present the executive briefing

Chap 10: Sales Skills

  1. Establish Rapport
  2. Qualify the buyer (find the need)
  3. Build Value
  4. Create Desire
  5. Overcome Objections
  6. Close the Sale
  7. Follow Up

Chap 11: Follow-up and Bonding Skills

  1. Send the first follow-up letter
  2. Make the first follow-up call
  3. Share something amusing or of personal interest
  4. Throw a party, share a meal, and bond like crazy
  5. Send another fax/email/letter/card
  6. Plan something fun that can include the family
  7. Offer something to help their business
  8. Send another fax/email/letter/card
  9. Offer more help to succeed
  10. Invite them to your home or be invited to theirs

Chap 12: All Systems Go
